meanings.definition: The act of enacting or putting into action.
meanings.sent1: Her enaction of the plan impressed everyone with her leadership skills.
meanings.sent2: The enaction of new laws is essential for a functioning society.
meanings.sent3: The enaction of the play was so realistic that the audience thought it was real!
meanings.sent4: His enaction of the role was like watching a master painter at work.
meanings.sent5: The enaction of the dance routine left the audience in awe of her talent.

meanings.definition: The process of making something happen or come into being.
meanings.sent1: The enaction of the project required careful planning and execution.
meanings.sent2: Without enaction, ideas remain just thoughts in our minds.
meanings.sent3: The enaction of the magic trick left everyone amazed at the illusion.
meanings.sent4: The enaction of the sunrise painted the sky with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: Through enaction, dreams can turn into reality.

meanings.definition: The act of performing or carrying out a task or action.
meanings.sent1: His enaction of the rescue mission saved the stranded hikers.
meanings.sent2: Teamwork is crucial for the successful enaction of the project.
meanings.sent3: The enaction of the comedy skit had the audience laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The enaction of the plan was like watching a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: Her enaction of the speech captivated the entire audience.
